titleStmt.title: The defence of the people called Quakers: being a reply, to a book lately published by certain priests of the county of Norfolk, under the pretended title of The Quakers challenge. And containing, some brief and modest animadversions upon the book it self. Several certificates, which detect the errors in those of West-Dereham, and clear the people called Quakers of the said challenge. The letters that passed between them and the priests.
titleStmt.author: Ashby, Richard, 1663?-1734.

titleStmt.title: The defence of the people called Quakers: being a reply, to a book lately published by certain priests of the county of Norfolk, under the pretended title of The Quakers challenge. And containing, some brief and modest animadversions upon the book it self. Several certificates, which detect the errors in those of West-Dereham, and clear the people called Quakers of the said challenge. The letters that passed between them and the priests.
titleStmt.author: Ashby, Richard, 1663?-1734.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed and sold by T[ace] Sowle, in White-Hart-Court in Gracious-street, and at the Bible in Leaden-Hall-street,

notesStmt.note: With an errata at the bottom of p. 52.
Preface signed by Richard Ashby, Thomas Bonnet, John Hubbard, John Fiddeman, Daniel Phillips, and Tho. Buckingham.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
